intro: Leptandra caerulea, commonly known as bluebeard, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features showy, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a reddish or purple hue when young. Leptandra caerulea thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
